helpText.value: Expand to explore graph of function versus angle.
Expand to show angle measure, coordinates, and trig value.
Compare values and graphs of different trig functions.
Move point on circle to change angle.
Move point on graph to change theta.
Explore with or without angles constrained to multiples of 30, 45, 60, and 90 degrees.

playArea.value: An interactive circle with a radius of 1 is centered on a coordinate plane. A movable point on the circle defines an angle theta as the point is rotated counterclockwise or clockwise from the x-axis. A right triangle is formed by the radius, a vertical line from the point to the x-axis, and the x-axis. There are options to explore different trigonometric functions and simultaneously highlight sides of the triangle inside the circle. Below the circle, an accordion box can display a graph of the selected function versus theta. The graph has a corresponding movable point which can go off screen.

controlArea.value: Use labels, background grid, and special angles, as needed, to guide your exploration of trigonometric functions. Reset the sim to start over.

quadrantInfoPattern.value: Currently, the movable point on the circle is in quadrant {{n}} of the coordinate plane.

clockwiseAngle.value: An angle theta is formed by a clockwise rotation of the point.

counterClockwiseAngle.value: An angle theta is formed by a counterclockwise rotation of the point.

valuesDescriptionPattern.value: The angle is {{angle}}. For this angle, x equals {{xValue}}; y equals {{yValue}}; {{trigFunction}} equals {{trigValue}}.

interactionHint.value: Move point on circle or graph to explore different angles.
